background: Children can go to school either by van or by minibus. Each mode of transportation has a certain capacity and associated pollution. The goal is to transport kids to school while minimizing pollution and adhering to the given constraints regarding the capacities and the transport vehicle limits.
constraints: Number of kids transported must be at least MinKids
Number of minibuses used is non-negative
Number of vans used is non-negative
A van can transport up to VanCapacity kids
A minibus can transport up to MinibusCapacity kids
No more than MaxMinibuses minibuses can be used
objective: Minimize the total amount of pollution produced
description: Children can go to school either by van or by minibus. A van can take \param{VanCapacity} kids and produces \param{VanPollution} units of pollution. A minibus can take \param{MinibusCapacity} kids and produces \param{MinibusPollution} units of pollution. There are at least \param{MinKids} kids that need to go to school and at most \param{MaxMinibuses} minibuses can be used. In addition, the number of vans used must exceed the number of minibuses. How many of each should be used to minimize the total amount of pollution produced?

parameters.definition: Minimum number of kids that need transportation
